platforms.name: Consensus
platforms.description: Consensus is an AI-powered search engine designed specifically for scientific research. It uses large language models (LLMs) to read, extract, and synthesize findings directly from peer-reviewed academic papers, allowing users to ask research questions in plain English and get evidence-based answers with citations. It uniquely focuses on providing consensus-level insights by analyzing multiple studies, making it a powerful tool for students, researchers, and professionals who need to quickly understand the scientific landscape on a topic.
keyFeatures: Plain-language querying of scientific database (e.g., 'Does creatine improve memory?')
Instant extraction of key findings and 'yes/no' consensus from papers
One-click generation of evidence-based summaries synthesizing multiple sources

platforms.name: CLARIN NER Tools
platforms.description: CLARIN is a European research infrastructure providing unified access to language resources and technologies for the humanities and social sciences. Its NER tools are a curated collection of 23+ interoperable services for identifying and classifying named entities (like persons, locations, organizations) in text across numerous languages and specialized domains. It uniquely serves as a federated, academic-grade platform that standardizes access to diverse tools, promoting reproducibility and collaboration in scholarly research.
keyFeatures: Federated access to 23+ distinct NER tools via the CLARIN service grid
Support for major European languages (e.g., Dutch, German, Swedish, English) and some non-European ones
Tools for both contemporary and historical text domains

platforms.name: Tavily Research Agent
platforms.description: Tavily is an AI-powered research assistant that autonomously conducts deep, multi-source internet research to answer complex queries. It synthesizes information from diverse sources, generates comprehensive reports with citations, and is designed for professionals who need fast, reliable insights. Its unique value lies in its agentic workflow that goes beyond simple search by planning, executing, and synthesizing multiple queries to produce a coherent, sourced answer.
keyFeatures: Autonomous multi-query research agent that plans and executes a search strategy
Synthesis of information from up to 10+ sources per query into a coherent answer
Automatic citation generation with source links for fact verification

platforms.name: Artifact 2.0
platforms.description: Artifact 2.0 is a personal AI research assistant that autonomously synthesizes knowledge from your private document library (PDFs, notes, articles) and the live web to answer complex questions and generate insights. Its key capability is performing multi-step, autonomous research by breaking down queries, searching diverse sources, and synthesizing findings with citations. It uniquely targets knowledge workers, researchers, and professionals who need to ground AI analysis in both their personal data and current public information, moving beyond simple chat to actionable research.
keyFeatures: Autonomous Research Agent: Breaks down complex queries into multi-step research plans, searches the web and your docs, and synthesizes answers with citations.
Unified Knowledge Base: Ingests and indexes personal documents (PDFs, TXT, Markdown, Word, PowerPoint, images) alongside saved web articles.
Chat with Citations: Interactive Q&A interface providing detailed answers with inline citations linking to source documents or web pages.

platforms.name: Aomni 2.0
platforms.description: Aomni is an autonomous AI research agent that performs deep, real-time web research on any company or market to deliver actionable intelligence reports. It autonomously browses, analyzes, and synthesizes data from diverse sources, including news, financials, and reviews, into structured competitive and market analysis. Its unique value lies in its multi-agent collaboration system, which mimics a team of analysts to provide comprehensive, cited insights for strategic decision-making.
keyFeatures: Autonomous, real-time web crawling and data extraction from public sources
Multi-agent collaboration framework where specialized agents research, analyze, and synthesize
Generates comprehensive PDF/PPT reports with executive summaries, SWOT analyses, and market landscapes

platforms.name: Eureka v2
platforms.description: Eureka v2 is an advanced AI agent platform from NVIDIA Research that autonomously generates sophisticated reward functions using large language models (LLMs) and trains robots via large-scale reinforcement learning in simulation. It specializes in enabling complex dexterous manipulation skills—such as pen spinning, rapid cube manipulation, and tool use—with high sample efficiency and successful sim-to-real transfer. Its unique capability lies in its closed-loop, iterative reward refinement process, where the LLM critiques and improves reward code based on training outcomes, making it a powerful tool for robotics researchers and developers tackling challenging real-world manipulation tasks.
keyFeatures: LLM-driven autonomous reward function generation and iterative refinement
Large-scale, GPU-accelerated reinforcement learning in NVIDIA Isaac Gym
Training for complex in-hand manipulation and tool-use skills (e.g., pen spinning, cube solving)
